summary:
Llamas are friendly, herd-dwelling animals native to South America. They are domesticated for their meat and as pack animals, carrying up to 30% of their body weight over long distances. Llamas have soft wool and are smart, learning tasks quickly.

Their ancestors originated in North America but migrated south millions of years ago. Today, llamas are also found in the United States and Canada, with over 158,000 there. In Aymara culture, llamas hold mythological significance, even being linked to rain and the end of time.
title: Llama
